issue.title: lamanlabuh.aduankonten.id
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Trackers)
 [http://lamanlabuh.aduankonten.id](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=http%3A%2F%2Flamanlabuh.aduankonten.id)
### Comment
> This is a tracking domain by Indonesian Government when user is trying to visit blocked page. The DPI middlebox sent a bogus 302 redirection to lamanlabuh.aduankonten.id to show the block page and track user what blocked page they're visiting. This domain also has been blocked in several DNS provider like ControlD and has been documented in wikipedia. Please add this to your list
Username: `@slashid`

issue.title: sonixgvn.net URL blockage exception
issue.body: ### Prerequisites - [X] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml); - [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue; - [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date; - [X] Browser version is up-to-date; - [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue. ### What product do you use? AdGuard Browser Extension ### AdGuard version 4.4.18 ### What type of problem have you encountered? Annoyances — pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc. ### Which browser(s) do you use? Firefox, Chrome ### Which device do you use? Desktop ### Where is the problem encountered? sonixgvn.net ### Ad Blocking AdGuard Base filter ### Privacy _No response_ ### Social Widgets _No response_ ### Annoyances _No response_ ### Security _No response_ ### Other _No response_ ### DNS filters _No response_ ### Language-specific _No response_ ### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled? _No response_ ### Add your comment and screenshots 1. I know there is a similar case like [this ](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/186942). But, that one is for adblock blocker. Since this is file-hosting site, adguard aggressively block the element that contain the URL that leads to external site. Is it possible to make an exception or at least make the URL visible? Example: https://sonixgvn.net/zettai-meirei-isekai-soushin-party-theme-song-cd/ 2. Screenshots Extension enabled Extension disabled ### Privacy - [X] I agree to follow this condition

issue.body: ### Prerequisites - [X] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml); - [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue; - [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date; - [X] Browser version is up-to-date; - [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue. ### What product do you use? AdGuard Browser Extension ### AdGuard version 4.4.18 ### What type of problem have you encountered? Annoyances — pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc. ### Which browser(s) do you use? Firefox, Chrome ### Which device do you use? Desktop ### Where is the problem encountered? sonixgvn.net ### Ad Blocking AdGuard Base filter ### Privacy _No response_ ### Social Widgets _No response_ ### Annoyances _No response_ ### Security _No response_ ### Other _No response_ ### DNS filters _No response_ ### Language-specific _No response_ ### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled? _No response_ ### Add your comment and screenshots 1. I know there is a similar case like [this ](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/186942). But, that one is for adblock blocker. Since this is file-hosting site, adguard aggressively block the element that contain the URL that leads to external site. Is it possible to make an exception or at least make the URL visible? Example: https://sonixgvn.net/zettai-meirei-isekai-soushin-party-theme-song-cd/ 2. Screenshots Extension enabled Extension disabled ### Privacy - [X] I agree to follow this condition

comment.body:
The problem is that MV3 extension cannot update filters (the whole extension must be updated), so it probably doesn't have new rules yet.
You can add this rule:
```adblock
sonixgvn.net#%#//scriptlet('abort-on-stack-trace', 'Object.defineProperty', '/https?:\/\/sonixgvn\.net\/.*\.js:|data:text\/javascript;base64|blocker|crabdance\.com|\/ads\//')
```
to user rules.

pull_request.title: Bump lint-staged from 15.2.7 to 15.2.10
pull_request.body:
Bumps [lint-staged](https://github.com/lint-staged/lint-staged) from 15.2.7 to 15.2.10.
Release notes

Sourced from lint-staged's releases.

v15.2.10

Patch Changes

  • #1471 e3f283b Thanks @​iiroj! - Update minor dependencies, including micromatch@~4.0.8.

v15.2.9

Patch Changes

  • #1463 b69ce2d Thanks @​iiroj! - Set the maximum number of event listeners to the number of tasks. This should silence the console warning MaxListenersExceededWarning: Possible EventEmitter memory leak detected.

v15.2.8

Patch Changes

  • f0480f0 Thanks @​iiroj! - In the previous version the native git rev-parse --show-toplevel command was taken into use for resolving the current git repo root. This version switched the --show-toplevel flag with --show-cdup, because on Git installed via MSYS2 the former was returning absolute paths that do not work with Node.js child_process. The new flag returns a path relative to the working directory, avoiding the issue.

    The GitHub Actions workflow has been updated to install Git via MSYS2, to ensure better future compatibility; using the default Git binary in the GitHub Actions runner was working correctly even with MSYS2.

Changelog

Sourced from lint-staged's changelog.

15.2.10

Patch Changes

  • #1471 e3f283b Thanks @​iiroj! - Update minor dependencies, including micromatch@~4.0.8.

15.2.9

Patch Changes

  • #1463 b69ce2d Thanks @​iiroj! - Set the maximum number of event listeners to the number of tasks. This should silence the console warning MaxListenersExceededWarning: Possible EventEmitter memory leak detected.

15.2.8

Patch Changes

  • f0480f0 Thanks @​iiroj! - In the previous version the native git rev-parse --show-toplevel command was taken into use for resolving the current git repo root. This version switched the --show-toplevel flag with --show-cdup, because on Git installed via MSYS2 the former was returning absolute paths that do not work with Node.js child_process. The new flag returns a path relative to the working directory, avoiding the issue.

    The GitHub Actions workflow has been updated to install Git via MSYS2, to ensure better future compatibility; using the default Git binary in the GitHub Actions runner was working correctly even with MSYS2.

Commits
  • 163112f chore(changeset): release
  • 829575c Merge pull request #1471 from lint-staged/updates
  • 893ca84 refactor: remove unused parameter default
  • a661f46 build(deps): migrate to ESLint 9
  • e3f283b build(deps): update minor dependencies
  • 35483b9 docs: add some more concrete command examples to the README
  • 0ce5e14 chore(changeset): release (#1465)
  • b69ce2d fix: set max event listeners to the number of tasks (#1463)
  • 52f6eef chore(changeset): release (#1462)
  • 8d8fe23 build: update repository url in package.json
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

pull_request.title: Bump lint-staged from 15.2.7 to 15.2.9
pull_request.body:
Bumps [lint-staged](https://github.com/lint-staged/lint-staged) from 15.2.7 to 15.2.9.
Release notes

Sourced from lint-staged's releases.

v15.2.9

Patch Changes

  • #1463 b69ce2d Thanks @​iiroj! - Set the maximum number of event listeners to the number of tasks. This should silence the console warning MaxListenersExceededWarning: Possible EventEmitter memory leak detected.

v15.2.8

Patch Changes

  • f0480f0 Thanks @​iiroj! - In the previous version the native git rev-parse --show-toplevel command was taken into use for resolving the current git repo root. This version switched the --show-toplevel flag with --show-cdup, because on Git installed via MSYS2 the former was returning absolute paths that do not work with Node.js child_process. The new flag returns a path relative to the working directory, avoiding the issue.

    The GitHub Actions workflow has been updated to install Git via MSYS2, to ensure better future compatibility; using the default Git binary in the GitHub Actions runner was working correctly even with MSYS2.

Changelog

issue.title: www.youtube.com

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

labels.name: NSFW
labels.description: Nudes and porn sites

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS. 


Previous issue https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/178790

The result is this; > > (AdGuard disabled) > Mozilla/5.0 (Linux; Android 10; K) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/128.0.0.0 Mobile Safari/537.36 > > (AdGuard enabled) > Mozilla/5.0 (Linux; Android 10) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/128.0.0.0 Mobile Safari/537.36 > > This should not be done. Google Chrome has reduced the UA and the string that used to show Device Model has been replaced by a "K" for all devices. pull_request.title: Bump markdownlint from 0.34.0 to 0.35.0
pull_request.body:
Bumps [markdownlint](https://github.com/DavidAnson/markdownlint) from 0.34.0 to 0.35.0.
Changelog

Sourced from markdownlint's changelog.

0.35.0

  • Add MD058/blanks-around-tables
  • Use micromark in MD001/MD003/MD009/MD010/MD013/MD014/MD019/MD021/MD023/ MD024/MD025/MD039/MD042/MD043
  • Improve MD018/MD020/MD031/MD034/MD044
  • markdown-it parser no longer invoked by default
  • Add strict version of JSON schema
  • Improve performance
  • Update dependencies
Commits
  • fe02674 Update to version 0.35.0.
  • 6d097cc Add missing semicolon to address new code scanning warning.
  • 9c8e715 Create strict JSON Schema for configuration (standalone for ease of use) and ...
  • bbca3ad Bump eslint from 9.9.0 to 9.9.1
  • 0291179 Bump @​eslint/js from 9.9.0 to 9.9.1
  • 05a4674 Update README.md to say explicitly that all rules are enabled by default.
  • dfcb452 Cache all top-level calls to filterByTypes (~7% runtime reduction).
  • 85e704f Update to only invoke rules that are used at least once by the content.
  • 6870a48 Bump webpack from 5.93.0 to 5.94.0 in /micromark
  • 0d76960 Bump webpack from 5.92.0 to 5.94.0
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

pull_request.body:
Bumps [husky](https://github.com/typicode/husky) from 9.1.1 to 9.1.5.
Release notes

Sourced from husky's releases.

v9.1.5

What's Changed

  • fixes #1494, support pre-merge-commit hook by @​RainMeoCat in typicode/husky#1497

New Contributors

  • @​RainMeoCat made their first contribution in typicode/husky#1497

Full Changelog: https://github.com/typicode/husky/compare/v9.1.4...v9.1.5

v9.1.4

  • Improve deprecation notice

v9.1.3

  • fix: better handle space in PATH

v9.1.2

Show a message instead of automatically removing deprecated code.

This only concerns projects that still have the following code in their hooks:

- #!/usr/bin/env sh # <- This is deprecated, remove it
- . "$(dirname -- "$0")/_/husky.sh"  # <- This is deprecated, remove it

Rest of your hook code

Hooks with these lines will fail in v10.0.0
